intro: Euphrasia salisburgensis var. bergadensis, commonly known as the Bergadenskaya eyebright, is a perennial herb native to the alpine regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowering stems are often branched. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in herbal medicine.
